alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lake; Lauderdale; Obion; Shelby; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 03 at 6:08AM CST until March 03 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Crittenden County in eastern Arkansas... Eastern Cross County in eastern Arkansas... Lee County in eastern Arkansas... Central Mississippi County in eastern Arkansas... St. Francis County in eastern Arkansas... Central Pemiscot County in southeastern Missouri... Dyer County in Tennessee... Lake County in Tennessee... Lauderdale County in Tennessee... Obion County in Tennessee... Central Shelby County in Tennessee... Tipton County in Tennessee... * Until 915 AM CST. * At 608 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West Memphis, Dyersburg, Blytheville, Forrest City, Marion, Union City, Millington, Covington, Ripley, Wynne, Osceola, Caruthersville, Marianna, Hayti, Earle, Steele, Hughes, Luxora, Parkin and Wilson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Dyer; Lake; Lauderdale; Obion; Shelby; Tipton
